# Plot 1

This is the first plot, created with dummy data.

```{python, echo=false, fig.show=true}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Dummy data for Plot 1
x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y1 = np.sin(x)

# Create Plot 1
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 4))
plt.plot(x, y1, label='sin(x)')
plt.title('Plot 1: Sine Wave')
plt.xlabel('X-axis')
plt.ylabel('Y-axis')
plt.legend()
plt.show()
```

More text.


```{python, echo=false, fig.show=true}
# Dummy data for Plot 2
y2 = np.cos(x)

# Create Plot 2
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 4))
plt.plot(x, y2, label='cos(x)', color='orange')
plt.title('Plot 2: Cosine Wave')
plt.xlabel('X-axis')
plt.ylabel('Y-axis')
plt.legend()
plt.show()
```
